Diplopia is double vision of a single object.

Binocular diplopia is present when both eyes are open and disappears when either eye is occluded.

Monocular diplopia persists when the healthy eye is occluded and disappears when the affected eye is occluded.

question.title: What is the characteristic of diplopia?

option_a.title: Monocular diplopia persists when the healthy eye is occluded
option_a.description: This is a characteristic of diplopia

option_b.title: Binocular diplopia disappears when either eye is occluded
option_b.description: This is a characteristic of diplopia

option_c.title: Monocular diplopia disappears when the affected eye is occluded
option_c.description: This is a characteristic of diplopia

option_d.title: Binocular diplopia persists when both eyes are open
option_d.description: This is a characteristic of diplopia

correct_option.title: Monocular diplopia persists when the healthy eye is occluded
correct_option.description: This is a characteristic of diplopia
